definition: to drop anchor/to break down (of a car etc)
to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
anchor

sentences.english: Anchor wires should have a Spelter type socket at anchor side.
sentences.chinese: 抛锚绳靠锚的一端应使用锌压头。

sentences.english: Be anchored in the bay where all men ride.
sentences.chinese: 才在人尽可泊的港湾里抛锚。

sentences.english: They found a sheltered inlet and anchored the boat.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现了一个隐蔽的小港，抛锚泊了船。

sentences.english: A man's car stalled on a country road one morning.
sentences.chinese: 一天早上，一个男人开的车在乡间的路上抛锚了。

sentences.english: We had to push the car home as it broke down half way and we couldst know how to repair it.
sentences.chinese: 半路上车抛锚了，我们又无从修理，只得将其推回。

sentences.english: We lay at anchor outside the harbour.
The boats anchored along the shore at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 好几艘船拂晓时沿岸抛锚。

sentences.english: You must anchor before pilot arrives.
sentences.chinese: 你必须在引航员到来前抛锚。

sentences.english: Our truck broke down outside town.
sentences.chinese: 我们的卡车在城外抛锚了。

sentences.english: South of Tecate, California, the van broke down.
sentences.chinese: 在加利福尼亚州的特卡特南边，面包车抛锚了。

sentences.english: Also, you should know how to change a tire and jump start your car.
sentences.chinese: 当然你也该知道怎么换胎和推一部抛锚车。

sentences.english: You have permission to anchor at 0900 UTC.
sentences.chinese: 允许你船在协调世界时0900时抛锚。

sentences.english: I wanted to meet the doctor, but my car broke down.
sentences.chinese: 我想去接那个医生，但我的车抛锚了。

sentences.english: His car was stalled because of overloading.
sentences.chinese: 他的车因超载而抛锚了。

sentences.english: My mother can’t come for me because her car broke down.
sentences.chinese: 我妈妈的汽车抛锚了，所以就不能来看我了。

sentences.english: Your car broke down because you're a sociopath.
sentences.chinese: 你的车为什么会抛锚就是因为你不爱社交。

definition: to tow/towed vehicle/towing vehicle
to steer (the plane) away from/to drive away (from a place)/to leave
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
flat tire/burst tire/blowout
to go (of car, train etc)/to drive off
(of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
to anchor/anchorage/mooring (of a ship)
(of a ship) to strike a reef/(fig.) to hit a snag
to call at/to stop at/berth
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
ferry
to tailgate/to hit the car in front as a result of tailgating
tugboat/boat towed by a tugboat/to tow a boat
boat/vessel/ship/CL:條|条[tiao2],艘[sou1],隻|只[zhi1]
variant of 船[chuan2]
highway/expressway/same as 高速公路[gao1 su4 gong1 lu4]
to set sail
